fields.Description: Provide details as to what must occur in order to the solution to be accepted.
Provide the agenda of the expected content to be covered in each workshop.
Determine if there are any other possible solutions that could avoid the need for this change request.
Test context, provided automatically by test infrastructure
What is the predetermined contingency plan should this risk be realized?
Enter a detailed description of the work item. Use this field to provide context and relevant information.
Provide some context as to what impact this change request has on the project.
Provide any documentation if this change request is impeding progress in other areas of the project.
Provide a short explanation as to what is impeding the start or continued progress of the work required to complete this task.
Provide a brief summary as to how the issue was resolved.
Document the business justification as to why this change request is necessary.
Provide the listing of the key questions that are expected to be discussed and resolved as an outcome of the workshop.
Provide the subjective summary as to how well the objective was achieved in the sprint or program increment/tollgate.
How to see the bug. End by contrasting expected with actual behavior.
Provide details as to how the requirement was solved by other deliverables that will be produced to tailor the system to meet the client's needs.
Summarize the perceived risk impact being identified for this risk.
Provide information that will help in determining when the workshop should be scheduled.
Provide a brief write up as to the approach for the expected solution will be solved for.
Steps required to perform the test
Specify the perceived project impact this issue is causing.
List any identified triggers that may cause this risk to be invoked.
List various assumptions and pre-requisites expected prior to each workshop.
Capture the original estimate for the task.
Update the remaining effort and/or re-estimate the task as often as needed.
Record the time completed against the tasks while active.
Enter the unique sequence ID for the business process. Use this to organize and reference processes.
Capture the date that the status report was created.

fields.Label: Status report for sprint
fields.Description: The iteration within which this issue will be fixed
Specify the current support level of the ticket.
Denote the primary resolution type that was used to resolve the issue.
Enter the name or role of the business process owner. Assign accountability for process management.
Enter the name or role of the workstream lead. Assign who will oversee and drive the team to produce the deliverables.
Enter the name or role of the subject matter expert for this work item. Identify who can provide guidance.
Indicate the party responsible for this work item (e.g., Business Process Owner, Project Manager).
Choose the program area (e.g., Reporting & Business Analytics, Solution Architecture) that best fits this work item.
Choose the type of role involved (e.g., Functional, Technical, Executive). Use the pick list for options.
Select the role responsible for this work item (e.g., Application Administrator, Data Architect). Use the pick list for options.
Select the contributor(s) for this work item. Use the pick list to assign roles or individuals.
Provide the status as to creating regression testing automation for the Test Case.
The reason why the bug was resolved
Assessment of the effect of the bug on the project
Document the type of change that is being requested in this change request.
Provide the identity of the individual who requested the change.
Capture the change order number that this change request has been accepted to for execution.
The date to start the work item.
The target date for completing the deliverable.
The individual who made the decision.
Estimate the number of weeks of duration for the phase.
Select what kind of issue is being cataloged.
Capture the individual who reported the issue.
Denote the type of activity the task needs to complete.

fields.Label: Estimate
fields.Description: The estimate in hours (or decimal for partial hours) to complete the work for the deliverable.
Specify the importance to the business.
A percentage indicating the estimated likelihood that the risk will occur
How severe is the impact of the reporting item/task?
General category in which risk will impact
Activities to be taken to lower the probability and/or impact of a risk.
Document the individual who owns the risk plan for this item.
The date the work item was created.
The user who created the work item.
The date the work item was closed.
The user who closed the work item.
Define the scope of the work item (e.g., In scope, Out of scope). Use the pick list for boundaries and expectations.
Select the fit-gap status (e.g., Fit, Gap) for this process. Use the pick list to indicate alignment with requirements.
Select the approach for addressing gaps (e.g., Customization, Third-party solution). Use the pick list for options.
fields.Rule name: Gap solution approach required for gaps

fields.Description: Provide the list of approved (original SOW plus approved Change Orders) hours.
Provide the list of approved (original SOW plus approved Change Orders) dollars.
Assign the Workstream that the Functional Area is being assigned to for each consecutive workstream of the project.
Catalog the type of objective for this record.
Provide the subjective grade as to how well the team did at achieving this objective in the given sprint or program increment/tollgate.
Select the baseline complexity (e.g., Simple, Medium, Complex) for this process. This value indicates the baseline suggested complexity for estimating the project effort related to the work product.
Select the estimated complexity (e.g., Small, Medium, Large) for this work item. Use the pick list to indicate project impact.
Select the estimated impact (e.g., Low, Medium, High) this work item will have on the project. Use the pick list to indicate significance.
The build in which the bug was found
Unknown
Provide a summary for how data is expected to be cleansed for the project prior to being migrated or integrated with.
Provide the executive summary as for the project for the period being covered by the current status report.
Provide the functional design details (content or hyperlink) for how the solution will meet the business needs.
Provide the name of the project that this status report is being provided for.
Provide the technical design details (content or hyperlink) for how the solution will meet be completed technically.
Indicate if there are compliance requirements for this work item. Set to "Yes" if regulatory or policy compliance is needed.
Select the type of configuration (e.g., Parameter, Setup data). Use the pick list to clarify configuration details.
Pick from the list the manner in which the data will be populated for this configuration.
Pick the technology(ies) that will be employed to solve the needs of the enhancement.
Specify the technology used for the interface (e.g., Power Automate, Azure Logic App).
Select the mode of interface (e.g., Real-time, Batch). Use the pick list for options.
Enter the technology used for data transformation (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Custom ETL tool).
Select the method used to validate data or processes (e.g., Audit trail review, Checksum validation). Use the pick list for options.
Enter the model used for the interface (e.g., API, File-based).
Specify the middleware technology used for integrations (e.g., Azure Logic App, Dataverse).
Specify the mechanism used for initial data synchronization (e.g., Batch, Real-time).
Enter the expected transaction volume during peak hours. Use this for system capacity planning.
Enter the expected average daily transaction volume. Use this for capacity and performance planning.
Enter the expected average number of transactions per hour. Helps with system sizing and monitoring as well as selecting the correct technology for the integration or data migration.
Select the type of data involved (e.g., Master data, Transactional data). Use the pick list for options.
Select the purpose of the job (e.g., Cleanup, Data processing). Use the pick list for options.
Select the type of job (e.g., Custom job, Integration). Use the pick list for options.
Select the type of job execution (e.g., Batch, Event-driven). Use the pick list for options.
Select how often this job or report should be executed (e.g., Daily, Weekly, Monthly). Use the pick list for options.
Select the technology or mechanism used to migrate data into the target system.
Specify the technology used for data scrubbing (e.g., Azure Data Factory, Custom ETL tool).
Enter the estimated volume of data to be migrated. Helps with planning and resource allocation.
Choose the type of report (e.g., Analytical, Audit, Financial). Use the pick list for options.
Specify the intended audience for the report (e.g., Internal Executive, External Customer). Use the pick list for options.
Select the technology used to generate the report (e.g., Power BI, SSRS). Use the pick list for options.
Choose the type of workflow associated with this work item (e.g., Custom workflow extension, Dataverse Business process flow). Use the pick list for options.
Specify the number of approval levels required for this workflow. Enter an integer value based on project needs.
Choose the type(s) of approval required (e.g., Compliance, Technical). Select from the pick list to clarify approval requirements.
Enter any configuration keys relevant to the application or module. Use this to manage feature access and settings.
Enter applicable country or region codes. Use this to specify localization or compliance requirements.
Enter any feature management keys relevant to the application. Use this to control feature availability.
Specify the source system for migration or integration (e.g., Business Central, Finance and Operations).
Enter the name of the source data entity for migration or integration. Track where data originates.
Specify the target system for migration or integration (e.g., Business Central, Finance and Operations).
Enter the target data entity in Finance and Operations for migration or integration.
Provide the name of the Data Package that this configuration will be added to in order to load into various environments.
Enter the execution sequence number within the named Data Package for this process or job. Use this to define order of operations.
Indicate if this field or process is mandatory. Set to "Yes" if required for completion.
Indicate if this configuration or field can be changed after initial setup. Set to "Yes" if changes are allowed.
Indicate if this configuration or field can be added later. Set to "Yes" if its not required at initial setup.
Indicate if this process or configuration should be completed early in the project lifecycle. Set to "Yes" if applicable.
Indicates if this process or configuration should be completed in the Gold environment. Gold configs are copied to production during cutover.
Indicate if this process or job is continuous. Set to "Yes" for ongoing or recurring activities.
Indicate if at least one configuration or recommendation is required. Set to "Yes" if mandatory.
Indicate if multiple recommendations are suggested for this configuration. Set to "Yes" if more than one approach is recommended.
Indicate what the current highest environment/branch is for the code or data attached to this deliverable.
Indicate the environment/branch that is authorized next for the code or data attached to this deliverable.
Enter any relevant Microsoft documentation or reference links that support this work item.
fields.Rule name: Microsoft Learn URL required for published articles

fields.Description: Provide any links to Partner documentation or references that support this work item.
Provide links to various client specific reference materials.
Add any comments or notes about updates made to this work item. Provide context for changes or revisions.
fields.Rule name: Updated rows require an update comment

fields.Description: Select the current status of the business process flow (e.g., Not started, In progress).This status indicates the status of the flow diagram from Microsoft being published in the Git Hub repository.
Select the current status of the catalog item (e.g., New, In progress, Published). Use this field to determine which rows are new, updated, or deprecated from Microsoft.
Select the current status of the article (e.g., Not started, Drafted, Published). This status indicates the progress of a Microsoft Learn article that documents the process.
Denote if the current version of this catalog entry is Microsoft, Partner or Project specific.
Indicates the unique Microsoft ID associated with this work item. This ID can be used for matching and taking updates to the work items.
Enter the partner ID if this process or item is managed by a partner. Required for custom processes involving external partners.

Enter the alternate sequence ID for deprecated or parallel processes. This value is required for any process that is deprecated and indicates the alternative process to use in place of the deprecated row.
fields.Rule name: Alternate process sequence ID required for deprecated processes

fields.Description: Select the Dynamics 365 module related to this work item (e.g., Accounts payable, Inventory management). Use the pick list for options.
Enter the menu path for accessing the relevant feature or process.
Enter the name of the menu item in the application. Use this to identify navigation points.
Select the industry or industries relevant to this work item (e.g., Manufacturing, Retail). Use the pick list for options.
Select the application family (e.g., Business Central, Finance and Operations) relevant to this work item. This helps categorize the process.
Select the relevant products (e.g., Business Central, Finance and Operations) associated with this work item. Use the pick list for options.
Select the Success by Design phase (e.g., Strategize, Implement, Test) relevant to this work item. Use the pick list for options.
Select the phase of the partner engagement. Map this to the Success by Design phases for consistency.
Enter the APQC ID for process mapping. Use this to align with industry-standard process frameworks.
fields.Rule name: If APQC ID contains a value, APQC description is required

fields.Description: Enter a brief description of the APQC process mapping. Required if APQC ID is provided.
Identify the type of workshop based on the listing of workshop types from Microsoft.
Specify the workshop type based on the partner's methodology.
Provide the sum of hours billed up to the cutoff for this status report.
Provide the sum of dollars billed up to the cutoff for this status report.
Provide the estimate at completion hours based on the current analysis.
Provide the estimate at completion dollars based on the current analysis.
Provide the current percent complete for the project.
Provide the current percent variance between approved dollars and estimate at completion dollars.
